    Simulating populations and studies

    Simulate a population and a study of it

    sim_pop_study.Rd

    Simulate a population and a study of it

    Usage

    sim_pop_study(
  phi,
  lambda,
  N.init,
  hist.len,
  srvy.yrs,
  k,
  f.year,
  p,
  L,
  imaf,
  clvng.p,
  tmp.emgn,
  alpha,
  clvng.ints
)

    Arguments

    phi

    The individual survival rate

    lambda

    The population growth rate

    N.init

    Initial population size

    hist.len

    Length of simulation

    srvy.yrs

    Survey years

    k

    Number of survey years

    f.year

    Final year of simulation

    p

    Capture probability

    L

    Number of genotype loci

    imaf

    Initial minor allele frequency

    clvng.p

    Additional calving probability

    tmp.emgn

    Rate of temporary immigration

    alpha

    Age of sexual maturity

    clvng.ints

    Whether females should be selected for calving by time since last calving, producing intervals of standard length

    Value

    A dataframe with ID, mum, dad, capture, and calving columns, and several attributes.

    Examples

    # Simulate one population and study
pop_study = sim_pop_study(
  phi = 0.9, lambda = 1.05, N.init = 20, hist.len = 20, srvy.yrs = 20, k = 1,
  f.year = 20, p = 0.5, L = 10, imaf = 0.5, clvng.p = 0, tmp.emgn = 0,
  alpha = 5, clvng.ints = FALSE
)

# Look at it
head(pop_study)
#>    ID mum dad C20 Cvg20
#> 18 18  NA  NA   1     0
#> 21 21  12   2   1     1
#> 22 22   4   3   1     0
#> 32 32  19  17   1     0
#> 35 35  19  15   1     0
#> 46 46  22  10   1     0
names(attributes(pop_study))
#>  [1] "names"       "row.names"   "class"       "avg.phi.obs" "beta"       
#>  [6] "N.t.vec"     "ns.caps"     "Ns"          "ns.clvng"    "alive"      
#> [11] "alv.s.yrs"   "f.age"       "mum"         "dad"         "ID"         
#> [16] "ind.gts"
